content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 393.3 - Carrier relieved of payment into fund

State Regulations

In a death case, if the widow remarries or the dependents
die between the date of the award and six weeks thereafter, when the commuted
amount is due and payable into the aggregate trust fund, the carrier shall not
be required to pay the commuted amount into the fund. The carrier shall be
relieved upon payment of compensation due up to the date of death of the
dependents or in case of a widow's remarriage, upon payment of compensation up
to the date of remarriage and two years compensation in a lump sum. In the case
of an award for a schedule loss, and the death of the claimant occurs between
the date of the award and six weeks thereafter, and there are dependents
entitled to the unpaid balance, the carrier shall be required to pay the
commuted amount into the aggregate trust fund. When the commuted amount payable
into this fund results from permanent total disability award, and the claimant
dies in the intervening six weeks' period, before such payment is due, the
carrier shall be relieved of payment of the commuted amount into the fund and
shall pay compensation up to the date of death of the
claimant. Notes
